text:
Hi <@U03NSBQA2UE>, I'm sorry that didn't work - being that it was another developer and you're not familiar with the code, it would be like trying to find a needle in a haystack for me to try to unravel the code to find the issue.

Maybe there is a more experienced developer like <@UCT32UWDV> who would be willing to take a look and point you in the right direction, but if not, you might need to consider posting it as a job and having a developer resolve the issue directly
thanks <@U03AKL6Q1B2> I am also a web developer, but I am not able to find the menu loading issue. :cry:

I'm sorry <@U03NSBQA2UE> I hope that didn't come across the wrong way about hiring a developer, it wasn't to say you weren't one, just that if you need help from someone with more experience with header modules, it might be an easier route to go

Hi - I mostly work with the CRM components of HubSpot and less with themes/front end, but am trying to figure out how to add a page break before a section in our quote template. I <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Quote-Custom-template-break-page/m-p/414054|found a great thread about others that have been able to do this with CSS>, but I'm not as well versed in CSS or HubSpot themes to understand the implication of editing it or creating a child theme. Can I create a child theme that just the quote template uses? I'll likely outsource someone adding it, but want to be sure I give adequate direction. Any general thoughts would be helpful. Thanks in advance!!

Hi Meredith. HubSpot quotes use a separate theme from your website theme. So a developer would have to match your branding and make any other style adjustments. Do you currently have a custom quote theme or default?

<@UG7S8J18D> - That makes sense and I appreciate this insight, that they'd have to customize the rest of the styling components. I believe we have a custom quote theme based on what those settings say, but it looks like a theme we installed if 'Flow' is not default.
The flow quote template is a default HubSpot theme. I just downloaded the custom quote files and don't see flow included. <@UBT0AHWLD> have you ever customized the flow quote theme?
